result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina M Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts
parties.address: 333 Vine St, Room 1200, La Crosse, WI 54601

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 13CF564, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant is not to own or run any businesses during term of probation
.

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge - amount to be determined

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be set up with the PO - Court orders the def to pay $100 per month with the first payment due 3-1-15 and the def is to pay $100 per month through 5-15-15;  Beginning 6-1-15 the defendant is to pay $200 per month until paid in full.  Restitution is to be paid to the DOC by a wage assignment

Complete any assessment and treatment recommended by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 4 days if probation is ever revoked (not to be applied to jail sentence)

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring with Jusitce Support Services
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with jail sentence in 13CF564
.
